congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
So the resolution was agreed to.

titleInfo.title: United States House Joint Resolution 83 (115th Congress)
United States House Joint Resolution 83 (115th Congress)
SEARCHING FOR AND CUTTING REGULATIONS THAT ARE UNNECESSARILY BURDENSOME ACT

name.namePart: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

extension.searchTitle: SEARCHING FOR AND CUTTING REGULATIONS THAT ARE UNNECESSARILY BURDENSOME ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 35

congVote.result: So the amendment was agreed to.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Searching for and Cutting Regulations that are Unnecessarily Burdensome Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House began consideration of H.R. 998, to provide for the establishment of a process for the review of rules and sets of rules. Consideration is expected to resume tomorrow, March 1st.<P/>McNerney amendment (No. 5 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to exempt from the bill rules relating to the physical and cyber security of the bulk-power system;<P/>Plaskett amendment (No. 4 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to provide that no funding will be authorized to carry out the requirements of this Act (by a recorded vote of 181 ayes to 243 noes, Roll No. 106);<P/>Krishnamoorthi amendment (No. 6 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to ensure that the SCRUB Act will not in any way hinder the safe and legal development and deployment of unmanned aerial systems (by a recorded vote of 189 ayes to 234 noes, Roll No. 107); and<P/>Krishnamoorthi amendment (No. 7 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to ensure that the SCRUB Act will not in any way weaken the protections afforded by noise restriction policies at and around airports (by a recorded vote of 192 ayes to 230 noes, Roll No. 108).<P/>H. Res. 150, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 998) and the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 83) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 225 ayes to 188 noes, Roll No. 104, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 224 yeas to 191 nays, Roll No. 103.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Searching for and Cutting Regulations that are Unnecessarily Burdensome Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House began consideration of H.R. 998, to provide for the establishment of a process for the review of rules and sets of rules. Consideration is expected to resume tomorrow, March 1st.<P/>McNerney amendment (No. 5 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to exempt from the bill rules relating to the physical and cyber security of the bulk-power system;<P/>Plaskett amendment (No. 4 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to provide that no funding will be authorized to carry out the requirements of this Act (by a recorded vote of 181 ayes to 243 noes, Roll No. 106);<P/>Krishnamoorthi amendment (No. 6 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to ensure that the SCRUB Act will not in any way hinder the safe and legal development and deployment of unmanned aerial systems (by a recorded vote of 189 ayes to 234 noes, Roll No. 107); and<P/>Krishnamoorthi amendment (No. 7 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to ensure that the SCRUB Act will not in any way weaken the protections afforded by noise restriction policies at and around airports (by a recorded vote of 192 ayes to 230 noes, Roll No. 108).<P/>H. Res. 150, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 998) and the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 83) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 225 ayes to 188 noes, Roll No. 104, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 224 yeas to 191 nays, Roll No. 103.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House began consideration of H.R. 998, to provide for the establishment of a process for the review of rules and sets of rules. Consideration is expected to resume tomorrow, March 1st.<P/>McNerney amendment (No. 5 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to exempt from the bill rules relating to the physical and cyber security of the bulk-power system;<P/>Plaskett amendment (No. 4 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to provide that no funding will be authorized to carry out the requirements of this Act (by a recorded vote of 181 ayes to 243 noes, Roll No. 106);<P/>Krishnamoorthi amendment (No. 6 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to ensure that the SCRUB Act will not in any way hinder the safe and legal development and deployment of unmanned aerial systems (by a recorded vote of 189 ayes to 234 noes, Roll No. 107); and<P/>Krishnamoorthi amendment (No. 7 printed in H. Rept. 115-20) that sought to ensure that the SCRUB Act will not in any way weaken the protections afforded by noise restriction policies at and around airports (by a recorded vote of 192 ayes to 230 noes, Roll No. 108).<P/>H. Res. 150, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 998) and the joint resolution (H.J.
